docs.lead_paragraph: Thousands of people waited for hours in single-digit temperatures on Saturday to try to get a ticket to President Barack Obama's farewell speech in his hometown of Chicago, saying they want to show their appreciation and soak in the final moments of his history-making presidency.

docs.lead_paragraph: Secretary of State John Kerry argued that Israel could not survive as both a Jewish state and a democratic state unless it embraced a two-state plan.
docs.abstract: Sec of State John Kerry gives extraordinarily blunt speech largely blaming ongoing conflict between Israel and Palestine on Israeli Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu; cites need to protect one of America's longest and closest allies from extreme elements in its own political culture; warns Netanyahu's continued support for West Bank settlements makes two-state solution increasingly impossible.

byline.contributor: Peter Baker contributed reporting from Jerusalem, and Michael D. Shear from West Palm Beach, Fla.

headline.main: Kerry Rebukes Israel, Calling Settlements a Threat to Peace
